headline.main: Eye Study on Marijuana Sought; Scientific and Legal Scrutiny Bourne 'Favored Extension

docs.abstract: Natl Eye Inst seeks scientific data to validate claims that marijuana may lessen severity of glaucoma; Dr Douglas Gaasterland says experimental drugs will be tested so as not to cause intoxication (S)

byline.original: By RICHARD D. LYONS Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29--The National Eye Institution announced today that it was soliciting research proposals from scientists to learn whether marijuana had a valid medical use as a treatment for glaucoma, an eye disease afflicting a million Americans.
docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29--The National Eye Institution announced today that it was soliciting research proposals from scientists to learn whether marijuana had a valid medical use as a treatment for glaucoma, an eye disease afflicting a million Americans.

headline.main: H.E.W. CHIEF ORDERS STRICT TOXIN RULES; Califano Cites Danger to Industrial Employees Who Also Smoke More Stringent Limits Possible Recipient of Cancer Society Award

docs.abstract: HEW Sec Califano orders development of safety standards for workers exposed to combined hazards of cigarette smoking and indus toxins (M)

keywords.value: TOBACCO, TOBACCO PRODUCTS AND SMOKERS ARTICLES
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Joseph A. Califano Jr., the Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, yesterday ordered the development of new safety standards for workers exposed to the combined hazards of cigarette smoking and industrial toxins.
docs.snippet: Joseph A. Califano Jr., the Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, yesterday ordered the development of new safety standards for workers exposed to the combined hazards of cigarette smoking and industrial toxins.
